67  # Sets the title of the window to match the current file.
68  proc set_title {} {
69 
70  # Get the current tab
71  if {![catch { get_info {} current tabbar}] && ([llength [$tabbar tabs]] > 0)} {
72  set tab_name [$tabbar tab current -text]
73  } else {
74  set tab_name ""
75  }
76 
77  # Get the host name
78  if {($::tcl_platform(os) eq "Darwin") && ([lindex [split $::tcl_platform(osVersion) .] 0] >= 16)} {
79  set host ""
80  } else {
81  set host "[lindex [split [info hostname] .] 0]:"
82  }
83 
84  if {[set session [sessions::current]] ne ""} {
85  wm title . "$tab_name ($session) \[${host}[pwd]\]"
86  } else {
87  wm title . "$tab_name \[${host}[pwd]\]"
88  }
89 
90  }

94  proc set_browse_directory {bsdir} {
95 
96  variable browse_dir
97 
98  set browse_dir $bsdir
99 
100  }

102  ######################################################################
103  # Returns the file browser directory path.
104  proc get_browse_directory {} {
105 
106  variable browse_dir
107 
108  switch $browse_dir {
109  last { return ""}
110  buffer { return [file dirname [get_info {} current fname]]}
111  current { return [pwd]}
112  default { return $browse_dir}
113  }
114 
115  }

118  # Creates all images.

120 
121  # Create tab images

123  {msgcat::mc "Image used in tab to indicate that the tab’s file is locked."} \
124  -file [file join $::tke_dir lib images lock.bmp] \
125  -maskfile [file join $::tke_dir lib images lock.bmp] \
126  -foreground 2
127  theme::register_image tab_readonly bitmap tabs -background \
128  {msgcat::mc "Image used in tab to indicate that the tab's file is readonly."} \
129  -file [file join $::tke_dir lib images lock.bmp] \
130  -maskfile [file join $::tke_dir lib images lock.bmp] \
131  -foreground 2
132  theme::register_image tab_diff bitmap tabs -background \
133  {msgcat::mc "Image used in tab to indicate that the tab contains a difference view."} \

135  -maskfile [file join $::tke_dir lib images diff.bmp] \
136  -foreground 2

138  {msgcat::mc "Image used in tab which, when clicked, closes the tab."} \
139  -file [file join $::tke_dir lib images close.bmp] \

251  $widgets(pw) add [ttk::frame $widgets(pw).tf]

254  set widgets(nb_pw) [ttk::panedwindow $widgets(pw).tf.nbpw -orient horizontal]
255 
256  # Add notebook
257  add_notebook
258 
259  # Pack the notebook panedwindow
260  pack $widgets(nb_pw) -fill both -expand yes
261 
262  # Create the find_in_files widget
263  set widgets(fif) [ttk::frame .fif]
264  ttk::label $widgets(fif).lf -text [format "%s: " [msgcat::mc "Find"]]
265  set widgets(fif_find) [ttk::entry $widgets(fif).ef]
266  set widgets(fif_case) [ttk::checkbutton $widgets(fif).case -text "Aa" -variable gui::case_sensitive]
267  ttk::label $widgets(fif).li -text [format "%s: " [msgcat::mc "In"]]
268  set widgets(fif_in) [tokenentry::tokenentry $widgets(fif).ti -font [$widgets(fif_find) cget -font] -tokenshape square]
269  set widgets(fif_save) [ttk::checkbutton $widgets(fif).save -text [msgcat::mc "Save"] \
270  -variable gui::saved -command [list search::update_save fif]]
271  set widgets(fif_close) [ttk::label $widgets(fif).close -image form_close]
272 
273  tooltip::tooltip $widgets(fif_case) [msgcat::mc "Case sensitivity"]
274 
275  bind $widgets(fif_find) <Return> [list gui::check_fif_for_return]
276  bind [$widgets(fif_in) entrytag] <Return> { if {[gui::check_fif_for_return]} break }
277  bind $widgets(fif_case) <Return> [list gui::check_fif_for_return]
278  bind $widgets(fif_save) <Return> [list gui::check_fif_for_return]
279  bind $widgets(fif_find) <Escape> [list set gui::user_exit_status 0]
280  bind [$widgets(fif_in) entrytag] <Escape> [list set gui::user_exit_status 0]
281  bind $widgets(fif_case) <Escape> [list set gui::user_exit_status 0]
282  bind $widgets(fif_save) <Escape> [list set gui::user_exit_status 0]
283  bind $widgets(fif_close) <Button-1> [list set gui::user_exit_status 0]
284  bind $widgets(fif_find) <Up> "search::traverse_history fif 1; break"
285  bind $widgets(fif_find) <Down> "search::traverse_history fif -1; break"
286  bind $widgets(fif_close) <Key-space> [list set gui::user_exit_status 0]
287

289  grid $widgets(fif).lf -row 0 -column 0 -sticky ew -pady 2
290  grid $widgets(fif).ef -row 0 -column 1 -sticky ew -pady 2
291  grid $widgets(fif).case -row 0 -column 2 -sticky news -padx 2 -pady 2
292  grid $widgets(fif).close -row 0 -column 3 -sticky news -padx 2 -pady 2
293  grid $widgets(fif).li -row 1 -column 0 -sticky ew -pady 2
294  grid $widgets(fif).ti -row 1 -column 1 -sticky ew -pady 2
295  grid $widgets(fif).save -row 1 -column 2 -sticky news -padx 2 -pady 2 -columnspan 2
296

300  ttk::menubutton $widgets(doc).mb -menu [menu .doc.docPopup -tearoff 0]
301  ttk::label $widgets(doc).l2f -text [format "%s: " [msgcat::mc "for"]]
302  ttk::entry $widgets(doc).e
303  ttk::checkbutton $widgets(doc).save -text [msgcat::mc "Save"] -variable gui::saved \
304  -command [list search::update_save docsearch]

309  bind $widgets(doc).e <Up> "search::traverse_history docsearch 1; break"
310  bind $widgets(doc).e <Down> "search::traverse_history docsearch -1; break"

312  bind $widgets(doc).mb <Escape> [list set gui::user_exit_status 0]
313  bind $widgets(doc).save <Return> [list set gui::user_exit_status 1]
314  bind $widgets(doc).save <Escape> [list set gui::user_exit_status 0]
315  bind $widgets(doc).close <Button-1> [list set gui::user_exit_status 0]
316  bind $widgets(doc).close <Key-space> [list set gui::user_exit_status 0]

320  pack $widgets(doc).l2f -side left -padx 2 -pady 2

463  ######################################################################
464  # Handles any menu popups that are needed in the information bar
465  proc handle_info_menu_popup {w mnu} {
466 
467  set menu_width [winfo reqwidth $mnu]
468  set menu_height [winfo reqheight $mnu]
469  set w_width [winfo width $w]
470  set w_x [winfo rootx $w]
471  set w_y [winfo rooty $w]
472 
473  set x [expr ($w_x + $w_width) - $menu_width]
474  set y [expr $w_y - ($menu_height + 4)]
475 
476  tk_popup $mnu $x $y
477 
478  }
479 
480  ######################################################################
481  # Returns 1 if a return key event should cause the find in files search
482  # to begin.
483  proc check_fif_for_return {} {
484 
485  variable widgets
486  variable user_exit_status
487 
488  if {([llength [$widgets(fif_in) tokenget]] > 0) && \
489  ([$widgets(fif_in) entryget] eq "") && \
490  ([$widgets(fif_find) get] ne "")} {
491  set user_exit_status 1
492  return 1
493  }
494 
495  return 0
496 
497  }
498 
499  ######################################################################
500  # Handles any preference changes to the Editor/WarningWidth setting.
501  proc handle_warning_width_change {name1 name2 op} {
502 
503  # Set the warning width to the specified value
504  foreach txt [get_all_texts] {
505  $txt configure -warnwidth [preferences::get Editor/WarningWidth]
506  }
507 
508  }
509 
510  ######################################################################
511  # Handles any preference changes to the Editor/MaxUndo setting.

720  ######################################################################
721  # Sets the auto_cwd variable to the given boolean value.
722  proc set_auto_cwd {value} {
723 
724  variable auto_cwd
725 
726  # Update the auto_cwd variable and if a file exists, update the current
727  # working directory if auto_cwd is true.
728  if {[set auto_cwd $value] && [files::get_file_num]} {
729 
730  # Get the current file information
731  get_info {} current fname buffer diff
732 
733  # If the current file is neither a buffer nor a difference view, update
734  # the current working directory and title bar.
735  if {!$buffer && !$diff} {
736  cd [file dirname $fname]
737  set_title
738  }
739 
740  }
741 
742  }

766  ######################################################################
767  # Sets up the tab popup menu.
768  proc setup_tab_popup_menu {} {
769 
770  variable widgets
771  variable file_locked
772  variable file_favorited
773  variable pw_current
774 
775  # Get the current information
776  get_info {} current txt fname readonly lock diff tabbar remote buffer txt2 beye
777 
778  # Set the file_locked and file_favorited variable
779  set file_locked $lock
780  set file_favorited [favorites::is_favorite $fname]
781 
782  # Set the state of the menu items
783  if {[files::get_file_num] > 1} {
784  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close All Other Tabs"] -state normal
785  } else {
786  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close All Other Tabs"] -state disabled
787  }
788  if {[llength [$widgets(nb_pw) panes]] == 2} {
789  if {[llength [$tabbar tabs]] > 1} {
790  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close Other Tabs In Pane"] -state normal
791  } else {
792  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close Other Tabs In Pane"] -state disabled
793  }
794  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close All Tabs In Pane"] -state normal
795  } else {
796  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close Other Tabs In Pane"] -state disabled
797  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Close All Tabs In Pane"] -state disabled
798  }
799  if {$diff} {
800  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Hide Tab"] -state disabled
801  } else {
802  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Hide Tab"] -state normal
803  }
804  if {([llength [$tabbar tabs]] > 1) || ([llength [$widgets(nb_pw) panes]] > 1)} {
805  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [format "%s*" [msgcat::mc "Move"]] -state normal
806  } else {
807  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [format "%s*" [msgcat::mc "Move"]] -state disabled
808  }
809  if {$readonly || $diff} {
810  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Locked"] -state disabled
811  } else {
812  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Locked"] -state normal
813  }
814  if {![file exists $fname]} {
815  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Favorited"] -state disabled
816  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Show in Sidebar"] -state disabled
817  } else {
818  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Show in Sidebar"] -state normal
819  $widgets(menu) entryconfigure [msgcat::mc "Favorited"] -state [expr {($diff || $buffer || ($remote ne "")) ? "disabled" : "normal"}]
820  }
821 
822  # Make the split pane and bird's eye indicators look correct
823  set menus::show_split_pane [winfo exists $txt2]
824  set menus::show_birdseye [winfo exists $beye]
825 
826  # Handle plugin states
827  plugins::menu_state $widgets(menu) tab_popup
828 
829  }

947  ######################################################################
948  # Updates the contents of the text within the tab as well as the
949  # title bar information to match the given tab.
950  proc update_tab {tab} {
951 
952  get_info $tab tab tabbar fname
953 
954  # Update the tab name

956 
957  # Update the title if necessary
958  set_title
959 
960  }
961 
962  ######################################################################
963  # Save the window geometry to the geometry.dat file.
964  proc save_session {} {
965 
966  variable widgets
967  variable last_opened
968 
969  # Gather content to save
970  set content(Geometry) [::window_geometry .]
971  set content(Fullscreen) [wm attributes . -fullscreen]
972  set content(CurrentWorkingDirectory) [pwd]
973  set content(Sidebar) [sidebar::save_session]
974  set content(Launcher) [launcher::save_session]
975 
976  # Calculate the zoomed state
977  switch [tk windowingsystem] {
978  x11 {
979  set content(Zoomed) [wm attributes . -zoomed]
980  }
981  default {
982  set content(Zoomed) [expr {[wm state .] eq "zoomed"}]
983  }
984  }
985 
986  foreach nb [$widgets(nb_pw) panes] {
987 
988  set tabindex 0
989  set current_tab ""
990  set current_set 0
991 
992  foreach tab [$nb.tbf.tb tabs] {
993 
994  # Get the file tab information
995  get_info $tab tab paneindex txt fname save_cmd lock readonly diff sidebar buffer remember remote txt2 beye
996 
997  # If we need to forget this file, don't save it to the session
998  if {!$remember || ($remote ne "")} {
999  continue
1000  }
1001 
1002  set finfo(pane) $paneindex
1003  set finfo(fname) $fname
1004  set finfo(savecommand) $save_cmd
1005  set finfo(lock) $lock
1006  set finfo(readonly) $readonly
1007  set finfo(diff) $diff
1008  set finfo(sidebar) $sidebar
1009  set finfo(buffer) $buffer
1010  set finfo(remember) $remember
1011 
1012  # Save the tab as a current tab if it's not a buffer
1013  if {!$finfo(buffer) && !$current_set} {
1014  set current_tab $tabindex
1015  if {[$nb.tbf.tb select] eq $tab} {
1016  set current_set 1
1017  }
1018  }
1019 
1020  set finfo(tab) $tabindex
1021  set finfo(language) [syntax::get_language $txt]
1022  set finfo(indent) [indent::get_indent_mode $txt]
1023  set finfo(modified) 0
1024  set finfo(cursor) [$txt index insert]
1025  set finfo(xview) [lindex [$txt xview] 0]
1026  set finfo(yview) [lindex [$txt yview] 0]
1027  set finfo(beye) [winfo exists $beye]
1028  set finfo(split) [winfo exists $txt2]
1029 
1030  # Add markers
1031  set finfo(markers) [list]
1032  foreach {mname mtxt pos} [markers::get_markers $tab] {
1033  lappend finfo(markers) $mname [lindex [split $pos .] 0]
1034  }
1035 
1036  # Add diff data, if applicable
1037  if {$finfo(diff)} {
1038  set finfo(diffdata) [diff::get_session_data $txt]
1039  }
1040  lappend content(FileInfo) [array get finfo]
1041 
1042  incr tabindex
1043 
1044  }
1045 
1046  # Set the current tab for the pane (if one exists)
1047  if {$current_tab ne ""} {
1048  lappend content(CurrentTabs) $current_tab
1049  }
1050 
1051  }
1052 
1053  # Get the last_opened list
1054  set content(LastOpened) $last_opened
1055 
1056  # Return the content array
1057  return [array get content]
1058 
1059  }
1060 
1061  ######################################################################
1062  # Loads the geometry information (if it exists) and changes the current
1063  # window geometry to match the read value.
1064  proc load_session {info} {
1065 
1066  variable widgets
1067  variable last_opened
1068  variable pw_current
1069 
1070  array set content [list \
1071  Geometry [wm geometry .] \
1072  CurrentWorkingDirectory [pwd] \
1073  Sidebar [list] \
1074  Launcher [list] \
1075  FileInfo [list] \
1076  CurrentTabs [list] \
1077  LastOpened ""]
1078 
1079  array set content $info
1080 
1081  array set finfo {
1082  xview 0
1083  yview 0
1084  cursor ""
1085  beye 0
1086  split 0
1087  }
1088 
1089  # Put the state information into the rest of the GUI
1090  if {[info exists content(Fullscreen)] && $content(Fullscreen)} {
1091  wm attributes . -fullscreen 1
1092  } else {
1093  wm geometry . $content(Geometry)
1094  if {[info exists content(Zoomed)] && $content(Zoomed)} {
1095  switch [tk windowingsystem] {
1096  x11 { wm attributes . -zoomed 1}
1097  default { wm state . zoomed}
1098  }
1099  }
1100  }
1101 
1102  # Restore the "last_opened" list
1103  set last_opened $content(LastOpened)
1104 
1105  # Load the session information into the sidebar
1106  sidebar::load_session $content(Sidebar)
1107 
1108  # Load the session information into the launcher
1109  launcher::load_session $content(Launcher)
1110 
1111  # Set the current working directory to the saved value
1112  if {[file exists $content(CurrentWorkingDirectory)]} {
1113  cd $content(CurrentWorkingDirectory)
1114  }
1115 
1116  # Put the list in order
1117  if {[llength $content(FileInfo)] > 0} {
1118  set ordered [lrepeat 2 [lrepeat [llength $content(FileInfo)] ""]]
1119  set i 0
1120  foreach finfo_list $content(FileInfo) {
1121  array set finfo $finfo_list
1122  lset ordered $finfo(pane) $finfo(tab) $i
1123  incr i
1124  }
1125  } else {
1126  set ordered [list "" ""]
1127  }
1128 
1129  # If the second pane is necessary, create it now
1130  if {[llength $content(CurrentTabs)] == 2} {
1131  add_notebook
1132  }
1133 
1134  # Add the tabs (in order) to each of the panes and set the current tab in each pane
1135  for {set pane 0} {$pane < [llength $content(CurrentTabs)]} {incr pane} {
1136  set pw_current $pane
1137  set tab ""
1138  foreach index [lindex $ordered $pane] {
1139  if {$index ne ""} {
1140  array set finfo [lindex $content(FileInfo) $index]
1141  if {[file exists $finfo(fname)]} {
1142  set tab [add_file $finfo(tab) $finfo(fname) \
1143  -savecommand $finfo(savecommand) -lock $finfo(lock) -readonly $finfo(readonly) \
1144  -diff $finfo(diff) -sidebar $finfo(sidebar) -lazy 1 \
1145  -xview $finfo(xview) -yview $finfo(yview) -cursor $finfo(cursor)]
1146  get_info $tab tab txt
1147  if {[syntax::get_language $txt] ne $finfo(language)} {
1148  syntax::set_language $txt $finfo(language)
1149  }
1150  if {[info exists finfo(indent)]} {
1151  indent::set_indent_mode $finfo(indent)
1152  }
1153  if {$finfo(diff) && [info exists finfo(diffdata)]} {
1154  diff::set_session_data $txt $finfo(diffdata)
1155  }
1156  if {$finfo(split)} {
1157  show_split_pane $tab
1158  }
1159  if {$finfo(beye)} {
1160  show_birdseye $tab
1161  }
1162  if {[info exists finfo(markers)]} {
1163  foreach {mname line} $finfo(markers) {
1164  markers::add $tab line $line $mname
1165  }
1166  }
1167  }
1168  }
1169  }
1170  if {$tab ne ""} {
1171  if {[catch { get_info [lindex $content(CurrentTabs) $pane] tabindex tabbar tab}]} {
1172  set_current_tab [get_info $pane paneindex tabbar] $tab
1173  } else {
1174  set_current_tab $tabbar $tab
1175  }
1176  }
1177  }
1178 
1179  }
1180 
1181  ######################################################################
1182  # Makes the next tab in the notebook viewable.
1183  proc next_tab {} {
1184 
1185  # Get the location information for the current tab in the current pane
1186  get_info {} current tabbar tabindex
1187 
1188  # If the new tab index is at the end, circle to the first tab
1189  if {[incr tabindex] == [$tabbar index end]} {
1190  set tabindex 0
1191  }
1192 
1193  # Select the next tab
1194  set_current_tab $tabbar [lindex [$tabbar tabs -shown] $tabindex]
1195 
1196  }
1197 
1198  ######################################################################
1199  # Makes the previous tab in the notebook viewable.
1200  proc previous_tab {} {
1201 
1202  # Get the location information for the current tab in the current pane
1203  get_info {} current tabbar tabindex
1204 
1205  # If the new tab index is at the less than 0, circle to the last tab
1206  if {[incr tabindex -1] == -1} {
1207  set tabindex [expr [$tabbar index end] - 1]
1208  }
1209 
1210  # Select the previous tab
1211  set_current_tab $tabbar [lindex [$tabbar tabs -shown] $tabindex]
1212 
1213  }
1214 
1215  ######################################################################
1216  # Makes the last viewed tab in the notebook viewable.
1217  proc last_tab {} {
1218 
1219  # Get the current tabbar
1220  get_info {} current tabbar
1221 
1222  # Select the last tab
1223  set_current_tab $tabbar [lindex [$tabbar tabs -shown] [$tabbar index last]]
1224 
1225  }
1226 
1227  ######################################################################
1228  # If more than one pane is displayed, sets the current pane to the other
1229  # pane.
1230  proc next_pane {} {
1231 
1232  variable widgets
1233  variable pw_current
1234 
1235  # If we have more than one pane, go to it
1236  if {[llength [$widgets(nb_pw) panes]] > 1} {
1237  set pw_current [expr $pw_current ^ 1]
1238  get_info {} current tabbar tab
1239  set_current_tab $tabbar $tab
1240  }
1241 
1242  }
1243 
1244  ######################################################################
1245  # Returns the number of panes.
1246  proc panes {} {
1247 
1248  variable widgets
1249 
1250  return [llength [$widgets(nb_pw) panes]]
1251 
1252  }
1253 
1254  ######################################################################
1255  # Returns the number of tabs in the current pane.
1256  proc tabs_in_pane {} {
1257 
1258  return [llength [[get_info {} current tabbar] tabs]]
1259 
1260  }
1261 
1262  ######################################################################
1263  # Aligns the current insertion cursors in both panes to the same Y
1264  # pixel value.
1265  proc align_panes {} {
1266 
1267  align_lines [get_info 0 paneindex txt] [get_info 1 paneindex txt] insert insert 1
1268 
1269  }

1271  ######################################################################
1272  # This is called by set_current_tab to update the pane sync state.
1273  proc pane_sync_tab_change {} {
1274 
1275  variable synced
1276  variable synced_key
1277 
1278  # Unselect the current key
1279  if {$synced_key ne ""} {
1280  catch {
1281  [winfo parent [lindex $synced_key 0]].vb configure -usealt 0
1282  [winfo parent [lindex $synced_key 1]].vb configure -usealt 0
1283  }
1284  menus::set_pane_sync_indicator 0
1285  set synced_key ""
1286  }
1287 
1288  # Set the new pair
1289  catch {
1290 
1291  # Get the current text widgets
1292  set txt1 [get_info 0 paneindex txt]
1293  set txt2 [get_info 1 paneindex txt]
1294 
1295  # Create the synced key
1296  set key "$txt1 $txt2"
1297 
1298  if {[info exists synced($key)]} {
1299 
1300  menus::set_pane_sync_indicator 1
1301 
1302  set synced_key $key
1303 
1304  [winfo parent $txt1].vb configure -usealt 1
1305  [winfo parent $txt2].vb configure -usealt 1
1306 
1307  }
1308 
1309  }
1310 
1311  }
1312 
1313  ######################################################################
1314  # Tracks the two displayed text widgets, keeping their views in line
1315  # sync with each other. If initialize is set, we will capture the
1316  # top lines.
1317  proc set_pane_sync {value} {
1318 
1319  variable synced
1320  variable synced_key
1321 
1322  # Get the displayed text widgets
1323  set txt1 [get_info 0 paneindex txt]
1324  set txt2 [get_info 1 paneindex txt]
1325 
1326  # Set the menu indicator to the given value
1327  menus::set_pane_sync_indicator $value
1328 
1329  if {$value} {
1330 
1331  # Record the synced_key (if this value is the empty string, we are not currently synced)
1332  set synced_key "$txt1 $txt2"
1333 
1334  # Record the text widgets that we are sync'ing
1335  set synced($synced_key) [list [$txt1 index @0,0] [$txt2 index @0,0]]
1336 
1337  # Set the scrollbar colors to indicate that we are synced
1338  [winfo parent $txt1].vb configure -usealt 1
1339  [winfo parent $txt2].vb configure -usealt 1
1340 
1341  } else {
1342 
1343  # Return the scrollbar colors to their normal colors
1344  [winfo parent [lindex $synced_key 0]].vb configure -usealt 0
1345  [winfo parent [lindex $synced_key 1]].vb configure -usealt 0
1346 
1347  # Delete the synced recording
1348  unset synced($synced_key)
1349 
1350  # Clear the synced key
1351  set synced_key ""
1352 
1353  }
1354 
1355  }
1356 
1357  ######################################################################
1358  # Called whenever one of the synced text widgets yview changes. Causes
1359  # the other text widget to stay in sync.
1360  proc sync_scroll {txt yscroll} {
1361 
1362  variable synced
1363  variable synced_key
1364  variable synced_count
1365  variable synced_txt
1366 
1367  # If we are not currently synced, return now
1368  if {($synced_key eq "") || (($synced_txt ne $txt) && ($synced_txt ne ""))} {
1369  set synced_txt ""
1370  return
1371  }
1372 
1373  set top [$txt index @0,0]
1374  lassign $synced_key txt0 txt1
1375  lassign $synced($synced_key) top0 top1
1376 
1377  if {$txt eq $txt0} {
1378  set line_diff [$txt count -lines $top0 $top]
1379  align_lines $txt0 $txt1 $top [$txt1 index "$top1+${line_diff}l"] 0
1380  } else {
1381  set line_diff [$txt count -lines $top1 $top]
1382  align_lines $txt1 $txt0 $top [$txt0 index "$top0+${line_diff}l"] 0
1383  }
1384 
1385  set synced_txt $txt
1386 
1387  }
1388 
1389  ######################################################################
1390  # Sync the birdseye text widget.
1391  proc sync_birdseye_helper {tab top} {
1392 
1393  variable be_after_id
1394 
1395  # Get the current tab
1396  if {[winfo exists [get_info $tab tab beye]]} {
1397  $beye yview moveto $top
1398  }
1399 
1400  set be_after_id($tab) ""
1401 
1402  }
1403 
1404  ######################################################################
1405  # Sync the birdseye text widget.
1406  proc sync_birdseye {tab top} {
1407 
1408  variable be_after_id
1409  variable be_ignore
1410 
1411  # If bird's eye view is not enabled, exit immediately
1412  if {![info exists be_after_id($tab)]} {
1413  return
1414  }
1415 
1416  if {$be_after_id($tab) ne ""} {
1417  after cancel $be_after_id($tab)
1418  }
1419 
1420  if {$be_ignore($tab) == 0} {
1421  set be_after_id($tab) [after 50 [list gui::sync_birdseye_helper $tab $top]]
1422  }
1423 
1424  set be_ignore($tab) 0
1425 
1426  }
1427 
1428  ######################################################################
1429  # Sets the yview of the given text widget (called by the yscrollbar)
1430  # and adjusts the scroll of the other pane if sync scrolling is enabled.
1431  proc yview {tab txt args} {
1432 
1433  # Return the yview information
1434  if {[llength $args] == 0} {
1435  return [$txt yview]
1436 
1437  # Otherwise, set the yview given the arguments
1438  } else {
1439  $txt yview {*}$args
1440  sync_birdseye $tab [lindex $args 1]
1441  sync_scroll $txt 0
1442  }
1443 
1444  }
1445 
1446  ######################################################################
1447  # Implements yscrollcommand for an editing buffer. Adjusts the scrollbar
1448  # position and performs synchronized scrolling, if enabled.
1449  proc yscrollcommand {tab txt vb args} {
1450 
1451  # Set the vertical scrollbar position
1452  $vb set {*}$args
1453 
1454  # Set birdseye view
1455  sync_birdseye $tab [lindex $args 0]
1456 
1457  # Perform sync scrolling, if necessary
1458  sync_scroll $txt 1
1459 
1460  }
1461 
1462  ######################################################################
1463  # Aligns the given lines.
1464  proc align_lines {txt1 txt2 line1 line2 adjust_txt1} {
1465 
1466  if {[set bbox1 [$txt1 bbox $line1]] eq ""} {
1467  $txt1 see $line1
1468  set bbox1 [$txt1 bbox $line1]
1469  }
1470  if {[set bbox2 [$txt2 bbox $line2]] eq ""} {
1471  $txt2 see $line2
1472  set bbox2 [$txt2 bbox $line2]
1473  }
1474 
1475  # Attempt to line up the right pane to the left pane
1476  $txt2 yview scroll [expr [lindex $bbox2 1] - [lindex $bbox1 1]] pixels
1477 
1478  # Check to see if the two are aligned, if not then attempt to align the left line to the right
1479  if {$adjust_txt1} {
1480  if {[lindex $bbox1 1] != [lindex [$txt2 bbox $line2] 1]} {
1481  $txt1 yview scroll [expr [lindex $bbox1 1] - [lindex $bbox2 1]] pixels
1482  }
1483  }
1484 
1485  }

1487  ######################################################################
1488  # Adds the given filename to the list of most recently opened files.
1489  proc add_to_recently_opened {fname} {
1490 
1491  variable last_opened
1492 
1493  if {[set index [lsearch $last_opened $fname]] != -1} {
1494  set last_opened [lreplace $last_opened $index $index]
1495  }
1496 
1497  set last_opened [lrange [list $fname {*}$last_opened] 0 20]
1498 
1499  }

1533  ######################################################################
1534  # Returns true if we have only a single tab that has not been modified
1535  # or named.
1536  proc untitled_check {} {
1537 
1538  variable widgets
1539 
1540  if {[files::get_file_num] == 1} {
1541  get_info {} current fname buffer txt
1542  if {($fname eq "Untitled") && $buffer && ([vim::get_cleaned_content $txt] eq "")} {
1543  return 1
1544  }
1545  }
1546 
1547  return 0
1548 
1549  }

1551  ######################################################################
1552  # Adds a new buffer to the editor pane. Buffers require a save command
1553  # (executed when the buffer is saved). Buffers do not save to nor read
1554  # from files. Returns the path to the inserted tab.
1555  #
1556  # Several options are available:
1557  # -lock <bool> Initial lock setting.
1558  # -readonly <bool> Set if file should not be saveable.
1559  # -gutters <list> Creates a gutter in the editor. The contents of list are as follows:
1560  # {name {{symbol_name {symbol_tag_options+}}+}}+
1561  # For a list of valid symbol_tag_options, see the options available for
1562  # tags in a text widget.
1563  # -other <bool> If true, adds the file to the other pane.
1564  # -tags <list> List of plugin btags that will only get applied to this text widget.
1565  # -lang <language> Specifies the language to use for syntax highlighting.
1566  # -background <bool> If true, keeps the current tab displayed.
1567  # -remote <name> If specified, specifies that the buffer should be saved to the given
1568  # remote server name.
1569  proc add_buffer {index name save_command args} {
1570 
1571  variable widgets
1572  variable pw_current
1573 
1574  # Handle options
1575  array set opts [list \
1576  -lock 0 \
1577  -readonly 0 \
1578  -sidebar 0 \
1579  -gutters [list] \
1580  -other 0 \
1581  -tags [list] \
1582  -lang "" \
1583  -background 0 \
1584  -remote ""
1585  ]
1586  array set opts $args
1587 
1588  # Perform untitled tab check
1589  if {[untitled_check]} {
1590  if {$name ne "Untitled"} {
1591  close_tab [get_info {} current tab] -keeptab 0
1592  }
1593  }
1594 
1595  # If the file is already loaded, display the tab
1596  if {($name ne "Untitled") && ([set file_index [files::get_index $name $opts(-remote) -buffer 1]] != -1)} {
1597 
1598  if {!$opts(-background)} {
1599  get_info $file_index fileindex tabbar tab
1600  set_current_tab $tabbar $tab
1601  }
1602 
1603  } else {
1604 
1605  if {$opts(-other)} {
1606 
1607  # If the other pane does not exist, add it
1608  if {[llength [$widgets(nb_pw) panes]] == 1} {
1609  add_notebook
1610  }
1611 
1612  # Set the current pane to the other one
1613  set pw_current [expr $pw_current ^ 1]
1614 
1615  }
1616 
1617  # Adjust the index (if necessary)
1618  set index [adjust_insert_tab_index $index $name]
1619 
1620  # Get the tabbar
1621  get_info $pw_current paneindex tabbar
1622 
1623  # Get the current index
1624  set tab [insert_tab $tabbar $index $name -gutters $opts(-gutters) -tags $opts(-tags) -lang $opts(-lang)]
1625 
1626  # Create the file info structure
1627  files::add $name $tab \
1628  -save_cmd $save_command \
1629  -lock $opts(-lock) \
1630  -readonly $opts(-readonly) \
1631  -sidebar $opts(-sidebar) \
1632  -buffer 1 \
1633  -gutters $opts(-gutters) \
1634  -tags $opts(-tags) \
1635  -remote $opts(-remote)
1636 
1637  # Get the current text widget
1638  get_info $tab tab txt tabbar
1639 
1640  # Perform an insertion adjust, if necessary
1641  if {[vim::in_vim_mode $txt.t]} {
1642  vim::adjust_insert $txt.t
1643  }
1644 
1645  # Change the tab text
1646  $tabbar tab $tab -text " [file tail $name]"
1647 
1648  # Add the file's directory to the sidebar and highlight it
1649  if {$opts(-sidebar)} {
1650  sidebar::add_directory [file dirname $name] -remote $opts(-remote)
1651  # sidebar::highlight_filename $name 0
1652  }
1653 
1654  # Make this tab the currently displayed tab
1655  if {!$opts(-background)} {
1656  set_current_tab $tabbar $tab
1657  }
1658 
1659  }
1660 
1661  # Set the tab image for the current file
1662  set_tab_image $tab
1663 
1664  return $tab
1665 
1666  }
1667 
1668  ######################################################################
1669  # Adds a new file to the editor pane.
1670  #
1671  # Several options are available:
1672  # -lock <bool> Initial lock setting.
1673  # -readonly <bool> Set if file should not be saveable.
1674  # -sidebar <bool> Specifies if file/directory should be added to the sidebar.
1675  # -gutters <list> Creates a gutter in the editor. The contents of list are as follows:
1676  # {name {{symbol_name {symbol_tag_options+}}+}}+
1677  # For a list of valid symbol_tag_options, see the options available for
1678  # tags in a text widget.
1679  # -other <bool> If true, adds the file to the other pane.
1680  # -tags <list> List of plugin btags that will only get applied to this text widget.
1681  # -name <path> Starting name of file (the file doesn't currently exist).
1682  proc add_new_file {index args} {
1683 
1684  array set opts {
1685  -name "Untitled"
1686  -save_as ""
1687  }
1688  array set opts $args
1689 
1690  # Add the buffer
1691  return [add_buffer $index $opts(-name) {eval files::save_new_file $opts(-save_as)} {*}$args]
1692 
1693  }
1694 
1695  ######################################################################
1696  # Creates a new tab for the given filename specified at the given index
1697  # tab position. Returns the path to the inserted tab.
1698  #
1699  # Several options are available:
1700  # -savecommand <command> Optional command that is run when the file is saved.
1701  # -lock <bool> Initial lock setting.
1702  # -readonly <bool> Set if file should not be saveable.
1703  # -sidebar <bool> Specifies if file/directory should be added to the sidebar.
1704  # -gutters <list> Creates a gutter in the editor. The contents of list are as follows:
1705  # {name {{symbol_name {symbol_tag_options+}}+}}+
1706  # For a list of valid symbol_tag_options, see the options available for
1707  # tags in a text widget.
1708  # -diff <bool> Specifies if we need to do a diff of the file.
1709  # -other <bool> If true, adds the file to the other editing pane.
1710  # -tags <list> List of plugin btags that will only attach to this text widget.
1711  # -remote <name> Name of remote connection associated with the file.
1712  proc add_file {index fname args} {
1713 
1714  variable widgets
1715  variable pw_current
1716  variable last_opened
1717 
1718  # Handle arguments
1719  array set opts {
1720  -savecommand ""
1721  -lock 0
1722  -readonly 0
1723  -sidebar 1
1724  -gutters {}
1725  -diff 0
1726  -other 0
1727  -tags {}
1728  -lazy 0
1729  -remember 1
1730  -remote ""
1731  -cursor 1.0
1732  -xview 0
1733  -yview 0
1734  }
1735  array set opts $args
1736 
1737  # If have a single untitled tab in view, close it before adding the file
1738  if {[untitled_check]} {
1739  close_tab [get_info {} current tab] -keeptab 0
1740  }
1741 
1742  # If the file is already loaded, display the tab
1743  if {[set file_index [files::get_index $fname $opts(-remote) -diff $opts(-diff)]] != -1} {
1744 
1745  # Get the tab associated with the given file index
1746  get_info $file_index fileindex tabbar tab
1747 
1748  # Otherwise, load the file in a new tab
1749  } else {
1750 
1751  if {$opts(-other)} {
1752 
1753  # If the other pane does not exist, add it
1754  if {[llength [$widgets(nb_pw) panes]] == 1} {
1755  add_notebook
1756  }
1757 
1758  # Set the current pane to the other one
1759  set pw_current [expr $pw_current ^ 1]
1760 
1761  }
1762 
1763  # Adjust the index (if necessary)
1764  set index [adjust_insert_tab_index $index [file tail $fname]]
1765 
1766  # Get the tabbar
1767  get_info $pw_current paneindex tabbar
1768 
1769  # Add the tab to the editor frame
1770  set tab [insert_tab $tabbar $index $fname -diff $opts(-diff) -gutters $opts(-gutters) -tags $opts(-tags)]
1771 
1772  # Create the file information
1773  files::add $fname $tab \
1774  -save_cmd $opts(-savecommand) \
1775  -lock $opts(-lock) \
1776  -readonly $opts(-readonly) \
1777  -sidebar $opts(-sidebar) \
1778  -buffer 0 \
1779  -gutters $opts(-gutters) \
1780  -diff $opts(-diff) \
1781  -tags $opts(-tags) \
1782  -loaded 0 \
1783  -remember $opts(-remember) \
1784  -remote $opts(-remote) \
1785  -xview $opts(-xview) \
1786  -yview $opts(-yview) \
1787  -cursor $opts(-cursor)
1788 
1789  # Run any plugins that should run when a file is opened
1790  plugins::handle_on_open [expr [files::get_file_num] - 1]
1791 
1792  }
1793 
1794  # Add the file's directory to the sidebar and highlight it
1795  if {$opts(-sidebar)} {
1796  sidebar::add_directory [file dirname $fname] -remote $opts(-remote)
1797  sidebar::highlight_filename $fname [expr ($opts(-diff) * 2) + 1]
1798  }
1799 
1800  # Make this tab the currently displayed tab
1801  if {!$opts(-lazy)} {
1802  set_current_tab $tabbar $tab
1803  }
1804 
1805  # Set the tab image for the current file
1806  set_tab_image $tab
1807 
1808  return $tab
1809 
1810  }
1811 
1812  ######################################################################
1813  # Inserts the file information and sets the
1814  proc add_tab_content {tab} {
1815 
1816  # Get some of the file information
1817  get_info $tab tab tabbar txt fname diff loaded xview yview cursor
1818 
1819  # Indicate that we are loading the tab
1820  $tabbar tab $tab -busy 1
1821 
1822  if {!$loaded && [files::get_file $tab contents]} {
1823 
1824  # Delete any dspace characters
1825  vim::remove_dspace $txt
1826 
1827  # Insert the file contents
1828  $txt fastinsert end $contents
1829 
1830  # Highlight text and add update code folds
1831  $txt highlight 1.0 end
1832  $txt see 1.0
1833 
1834  # Add any previous markers saved for this text widget
1835  markers::tagify $tab
1836 
1837  # Check brackets
1838  ctext::checkAllBrackets $txt
1839 
1840  # Change the text to unmodified
1841  $txt edit reset
1842  files::set_info $tab tab modified 0
1843 
1844  # Set the insertion mark to the first position
1845  ::tk::TextSetCursor $txt.t $cursor
1846 
1847  # Set the yview
1848  $txt xview moveto $xview
1849  $txt yview moveto $yview
1850 
1851  # Perform an insertion adjust, if necessary
1852  if {[vim::in_vim_mode $txt.t]} {
1853  vim::adjust_insert $txt.t
1854  }
1855 
1856  # Add the file to the list of recently opened files
1857  add_to_recently_opened $fname
1858 
1859  # Parse Vim modeline information, if needed
1860  vim::parse_modeline $txt
1861 
1862  # If a diff command was specified, run and parse it now
1863  if {$diff} {
1864  diff::show $txt
1865  }
1866 
1867  # Update tab
1868  update_tab $tab
1869 
1870  }
1871 
1872  # Specify that we have completed loading the tab
1873  $tabbar tab $tab -busy 0
1874 
1875  }
1876 
1877  ######################################################################
1878  # Add a list of files to the editor panel and raise the window to
1879  # make it visible.
1880  proc add_files_and_raise {host index args} {
1881 
1882  # Add the list of files to the editor panel.
1883  foreach fname [lreverse $args] {
1884  if {[file isdirectory $fname]} {
1885  sidebar::add_directory [files::normalize $host $fname]
1886  } else {
1887  add_file $index [files::normalize $host $fname]
1888  }
1889  }
1890 
1891  # Raise ourselves
1892  raise_window
1893 
1894  }
1895 
1896  ######################################################################
1897  # Raise ourself to the top.
1898  proc raise_window {} {
1899 
1900  variable widgets
1901 
1902  # If the notebook widget doesn't exist this will cause an error to occur.
1903  if {$widgets(nb_pw) ne ""} {
1904 
1905  wm withdraw .
1906  wm deiconify .
1907 
1908  }
1909 
1910  }
1911 
1912  ######################################################################
1913  # Update the file located at the given notebook index.
1914  proc update_file {file_index} {
1915 
1916  # Get the file information
1917  get_info $file_index fileindex tabbar tab txt fname diff lock remote
1918 
1919  # If the editor is a difference view and is not updateable, stop now
1920  if {$diff && ![diff::updateable $txt]} {
1921  return
1922  }
1923 
1924  # Get the current insertion index
1925  set insert_index [$txt index insert]
1926 
1927  # Delete the text widget
1928  $txt configure -state normal
1929  $txt delete 1.0 end
1930 
1931  if {[files::get_file $tab contents]} {
1932 
1933  # Read the file contents and insert them
1934  $txt insert end $contents
1935 
1936  # Change the tab text
1937  $tabbar tab $tab -text " [file tail $fname]"
1938 
1939  # Update the title bar (if necessary)
1940  set_title
1941 
1942  # Change the text to unmodified
1943  $txt edit reset
1944  files::set_info $file_index fileindex modified 0
1945 
1946  # Set the insertion mark to the first position
1947  ::tk::TextSetCursor $txt.t $insert_index
1948  if {[vim::in_vim_mode $txt.t]} {
1949  vim::adjust_insert $txt.t
1950  }
1951 
1952  # If a diff command was specified, run and parse it now
1953  if {$diff} {
1954  diff::show $txt
1955  }
1956 
1957  # Allow plugins to be run on update
1958  plugins::handle_on_update $file_index
1959 
1960  }
1961 
1962  # If we are locked, set our state back to disabled
1963  if {$lock} {
1964  $txt configure -state disabled
1965  }
1966 
1967  }
1968 
1969  ######################################################################
1970  # Updates the currently displayed file.
1971  proc update_current {} {
1972 
1973  update_file [get_info {} current fileindex]
1974 
1975  }
1976 
1977  ######################################################################
1978  # Prompts the user for a file save name. Returns the name of the selected
1979  # filename; otherwise, returns the empty string to indicate that no
1980  # filename was selected.
1981  proc prompt_for_save {} {
1982 
1983  # Get the directory of the current file
1984  set dirname [gui::get_browse_directory]
1985 
1986  # Get the list of save options
1987  set save_opts [list]
1988  if {[llength [set extensions [syntax::get_extensions]]] > 0} {
1989  lappend save_opts -defaultextension [lindex $extensions 0]
1990  }
1991 
1992  # Get the save file from the user
1993  return [tk_getSaveFile {*}$save_opts -parent . -title [msgcat::mc "Save As"] -initialdir $dirname]
1994 
1995  }
1996 
1997  ######################################################################
1998  # Performs a forced pre-save operation for the given filename.
1999  proc save_prehandle {fname save_as force pperms} {
2000 
2001  upvar $pperms perms
2002 
2003  set perms ""
2004 
2005  if {[file exists $fname]} {
2006  if {$save_as eq ""} {
2007  if {![file writable $fname]} {
2008  if {$force} {
2009  set perms [file attributes $fname -permissions]
2010  if {[catch { file attributes $fname -permissions 700} rc]} {
2011  set_info_message [msgcat::mc "No write permissions. Use '!' to force write."]
2012  return 0
2013  }
2014  } else {
2015  set_info_message [msgcat::mc "No write permissions. Use '!' to force write."]
2016  return 0
2017  }
2018  }
2019  } elseif {!$force} {
2020  set_info_message [msgcat::mc "File already exists. Use '!' to force an overwrite"]
2021  return 0
2022  }
2023  }
2024 
2025  return 1
2026 
2027  }
2028 
2029  ######################################################################
2030  # Performs a forced post-save operation for the given filename.
2031  proc save_posthandle {fname perms} {
2032 
2033  if {$perms ne ""} {
2034  catch { file attributes $fname -permissions $perms}
2035  }
2036 
2037  return 1
2038 
2039  }

2050  ######################################################################
2051  # Sets the current text status modification value to the specified value
2052  # and updates the titlebar and tabbar
2053  proc set_current_modified {value} {
2054 
2055  # Get the current file information
2056  get_info {} current tabbar tab txt fname
2057 
2058  # Set the file modified status to the given value
2059  files::set_info $tab tab modified $value
2060 
2061  # Set the text widget status
2062  if {$value == 0} {
2063  $txt edit modified $value
2064  }
2065 
2066  # Update the current tab text
2067  $tabbar tab $tab -text [format "%s %s" [expr {$value ? " *" : ""}] [file tail $fname]]
2068 
2069  # Update the title
2070  set_title
2071 
2072  }

2074  ######################################################################
2075  # Saves the current tab contents. Returns 1 if the save was successful;
2076  # otherwise, returns a value of 0.
2077  proc save_current {args} {
2078 
2079  array set opts {
2080  -force 0
2081  -save_as ""
2082  -remote ""
2083  }
2084  array set opts $args
2085 
2086  # Get current information
2087  get_info {} current tabbar tab txt fileindex fname buffer save_cmd diff buffer mtime sidebar
2088 
2089  # If the current file is a buffer and it has a save command, run the save command
2090  if {$buffer && ($save_cmd ne "")} {
2091 
2092  # Execute the save command. If it errors or returns a value of 0, return immediately
2093  if {[catch { {*}$save_cmd $fileindex} rc]} {
2094  return 0
2095  } elseif {$rc == 0} {
2096  set_current_modified 0
2097  return 1
2098  }
2099 
2100  # Retrieve some values in case they changed in the save command
2101  get_info {} current fname buffer save_cmd
2102 
2103  }
2104 
2105  # Get the difference mode of the current file
2106  set matching_index -1
2107 
2108  # If a save_as name is specified, change the filename
2109  if {$opts(-save_as) ne ""} {
2110 
2111  # Add the file to the sidebar and indicate that it is opened
2112  sidebar::highlight_filename $fname [expr $diff * 2]
2113  set matching_index [files::get_index $opts(-save_as) $opts(-remote)]
2114 
2115  # Set the filename, remote tag indicator and set the tab attributes to match
2116  # the same as a file
2117  files::set_info $fileindex fileindex \
2118  fname [set fname [file normalize $opts(-save_as)]] \
2119  remote [set remote $opts(-remote)] \
2120  readonly 0 buffer 0 remember 1
2121 
2122  # Update the tab image to reflect that fact that we not readonly
2123  set_tab_image $tab
2124 
2125  # If the current file doesn't have a filename, allow the user to set it
2126  } elseif {$buffer || $diff} {
2127 
2128  if {[set sfile [prompt_for_save]] eq ""} {
2129  return 0
2130  } else {
2131  set matching_index [files::get_index $sfile ""]
2132  files::set_info $fileindex fileindex fname [set fname $sfile]
2133  }
2134 
2135  }
2136 
2137  # Run the on_save plugins
2138  plugins::handle_on_save $fileindex
2139 
2140  # If we need to do a force write, do it now
2141  set perms ""
2142  if {![save_prehandle $fname $opts(-save_as) $opts(-force) perms]} {
2143  return 0
2144  }
2145 
2146  # If the file already exists in one of the open tabs, close it now
2147  if {$matching_index != -1} {
2148  close_tab [files::get_info $matching_index fileindex tab] -keeptab 0 -check 0
2149  }
2150 
2151  # Save the file contents
2152  if {![files::set_file $tab [scrub_text $txt]]} {
2153  return 0
2154  }
2155 
2156  # If we need to do a force write, do it now
2157  if {![save_posthandle $fname $perms]} {
2158  return 0
2159  }
2160 
2161  # If the file doesn't have a timestamp, it's a new file so add and highlight it in the sidebar
2162  if {($mtime eq "") || ($opts(-save_as) ne "")} {
2163 
2164  # Add the filename to the most recently opened list
2165  add_to_recently_opened $fname
2166 
2167  # If it is okay to add the file to the sidebar, do it now
2168  if {$sidebar} {
2169  sidebar::insert_file [sidebar::add_directory [file dirname $fname] -remote $opts(-remote)] $fname $opts(-remote)
2170  sidebar::highlight_filename $fname [expr ($diff * 2) + 1]
2171  }
2172 
2173  # Syntax highlight the file
2174  syntax::set_language $txt [syntax::get_default_language $fname]
2175 
2176  }
2177 
2178  # Set the modified state to 0
2179  set_current_modified 0
2180 
2181  # If there is a save command, run it now
2182  if {$save_cmd ne ""} {
2183  eval {*}$save_cmd $fileindex
2184  }
2185 
2186  return 1
2187 
2188  }
2189 
2190  ######################################################################
2191  # Saves all of the opened tab contents (if necessary). If a tab has
2192  # not been previously saved (a new file), that tab is made the current
2193  # tab and the save_current procedure is called.
2194  proc save_all {} {
2195 
2196  for {set i 0} {$i < [files::get_file_num]} {incr i} {
2197 
2198  # Get file information
2199  get_info $i fileindex tabbar tab txt fname modified diff save_cmd buffer
2200 
2201  # If the file needs to be saved, do it
2202  if {$modified && !$diff} {
2203 
2204  # If the file needs to be saved as a new filename, call the save_current
2205  # procedure
2206  if {$buffer && ($save_cmd ne "")} {
2207 
2208  # Run the save command and if it ran successfully,
2209  if {[catch { {*}$save_cmd $i} rc]} {
2210 
2211  continue
2212 
2213  } elseif {$rc == 0} {
2214 
2215  # Change the tab text
2216  $tabbar tab $tab -text " [file tail $fname]"
2217 
2218  # Change the text to unmodified
2219  $txt edit modified false
2220  files::set_info $i fileindex modified 0
2221 
2222  # Save the current
2223  } else {
2224 
2225  set_current_tab $tabbar $tab
2226  save_current -force 1
2227 
2228  }
2229 
2230  # Perform a tab-only save
2231  } else {
2232 
2233  # Run the on_save plugins
2234  plugins::handle_on_save $i
2235 
2236  # Save the file contents
2237  if {![files::set_file $tab [scrub_text $txt]]} {
2238  continue
2239  }
2240 
2241  # Change the tab text
2242  $tabbar tab $tab -text " [file tail $fname]"
2243 
2244  # Change the text to unmodified
2245  $txt edit modified false
2246  files::set_info $i fileindex modified 0
2247 
2248  # If there is a save command, run it now
2249  if {$save_cmd ne ""} {
2250  eval {*}$save_cmd $i
2251  }
2252 
2253  }
2254 
2255  }
2256 
2257  }
2258 
2259  # Make sure that the title is consistent
2260  set_title
2261 
2262  }

2264  ######################################################################
2265  # Returns 1 if the tab is closable; otherwise, returns a value of 0.
2266  # Saves the tab if it needs to be saved.
2267  proc close_check {tab force exiting} {
2268 
2269  # Get the tab information
2270  get_info $tab tab tabbar fname modified diff
2271 
2272  # If the file needs to be saved, do it now
2273  if {$modified && !$diff && !$force} {
2274  set fname [file tail $fname]
2275  set msg [format "%s %s?" [msgcat::mc "Save"] $fname]
2276  set_current_tab $tabbar $tab
2277  if {[set answer [tk_messageBox -default yes -type [expr {$exiting ? {yesno} : {yesnocancel}}] -message $msg -title [msgcat::mc "Save request"]]] eq "yes"} {
2278  return [save_current -force $force]
2279  } elseif {$answer eq "cancel"} {
2280  return 0
2281  }
2282  }
2283 
2284  return 1
2285 
2286  }

2288  ######################################################################
2289  # Returns 1 if the tab is closable; otherwise, returns a value of 0.
2290  # Saves the tab if it needs to be saved.
2291  proc close_check_by_tabbar {w tab} {
2292 
2293  return [close_check $tab 0 0]
2294

2331  ######################################################################
2332  # Close the specified tab (do not ask the user about closing the tab).
2333  proc close_tab {tab args} {
2334 
2335  variable widgets
2336  variable pw_current
2337 
2338  array set opts {
2339  -exiting 0
2340  -keeptab 1
2341  -lazy 0
2342  -force 0
2343  -check 1
2344  -tabbar ""
2345  }
2346  array set opts $args
2347 
2348  # Get information
2349  get_info $tab tab pane tabbar tabindex txt txt2 fileindex fname diff
2350 
2351  # Figure out if the tab has txt2 opened
2352  set txt2_exists [winfo exists $txt2]
2353 
2354  # Perform save check on close
2355  if {$opts(-check)} {
2356  if {![close_check $tab $opts(-force) $opts(-exiting)]} {
2357  return
2358  }
2359  }
2360 
2361  # Unhighlight the file in the file browser (if the file was not a difference view)
2362  sidebar::highlight_filename $fname [expr $diff * 2]
2363 
2364  # Run the close event for this file
2365  plugins::handle_on_close $fileindex
2366 
2367  # Delete the file from files
2368  files::remove $tab
2369 
2370  # Remove the tab from the tabbar (unless this has already been done by the tabbar)
2371  if {$opts(-tabbar) eq ""} {
2372  $tabbar delete $tabindex
2373  } else {
2374  set tabbar $opts(-tabbar)
2375  set pane [winfo parent [winfo parent $tabbar]]
2376  set pw_current [lsearch [$widgets(nb_pw) panes] $pane]
2377  }
2378 
2379  # Delete the text frame
2380  catch { pack forget $tab}
2381 
2382  # Destroy the text frame
2383  destroy $tab
2384 
2385  # Clean up any code that is reliant on the text widget (if we are not exiting
2386  # the application) to avoid memory leaks
2387  if {!$opts(-exiting)} {
2388  cleanup_txt $txt
2389  if {$txt2_exists} {
2390  cleanup_txt $txt2
2391  }
2392  }
2393 
2394  # Display the current pane (if one exists)
2395  if {!$opts(-lazy) && ([set tab [$tabbar select]] ne "")} {
2396  set_current_tab $tabbar $tab
2397  }
2398 
2399  # If we have no more tabs and there is another pane, remove this pane
2400  if {([llength [$tabbar tabs]] == 0) && ([llength [$widgets(nb_pw) panes]] > 1)} {
2401  $widgets(nb_pw) forget $pane
2402  set pw_current 0
2403  set tabbar [get_info 0 paneindex tabbar]
2404  }
2405 
2406  # Add a new file if we have no more tabs, we are the only pane, and the preference
2407  # setting is to not close after the last tab is closed.
2408  if {([llength [$tabbar tabs]] == 0) && ([llength [$widgets(nb_pw) panes]] == 1) && !$opts(-exiting)} {
2409  if {[preferences::get General/ExitOnLastClose] || $::cl_exit_on_close} {
2410  menus::exit_command
2411  } elseif {$opts(-keeptab)} {
2412  add_new_file end
2413  }
2414  }
2415 
2416  }

2634  ######################################################################
2635  # Sorts all of the open tabs (in both panes, if both panes are visible)
2636  # by alphabetical order.
2637  proc sort_tabs {} {
2638 
2639  variable widgets
2640 
2641  foreach nb [$widgets(nb_pw) panes] {
2642 
2643  get_info $nb pane tabbar tab
2644 
2645  # Get the list of opened tabs
2646  set tabs [list]
2647  foreach atab [$tabbar tabs] {
2648  set fullname [$tabbar tab $atab -text]
2649  regexp {(\S+)$} $fullname -> name
2650  lappend tabs [list $name $fullname $atab]
2651  $tabbar delete $atab
2652  }
2653 
2654  # Sort the tabs by alphabetical order and move them
2655  foreach atab [lsort -index 0 $tabs] {
2656  lassign $atab name fullname tabid
2657  $tabbar insert end $tabid -text $fullname -emboss 0
2658  }
2659 
2660  # Reset the current tab
2661  $tabbar select $tab
2662 
2663  }
2664 
2665  }

2667  ######################################################################
2668  # Moves the current notebook tab to the other notebook pane. If the
2669  # other notebook pane is not displayed, create it and display it.
2670  proc move_to_pane {} {
2671 
2672  variable widgets
2673  variable pw_current
2674 
2675  # Get the list of panes
2676  set panes [$widgets(nb_pw) panes]
2677 
2678  # If the other pane does not exist, add it
2679  if {[llength $panes] == 1} {
2680  add_notebook
2681  set panes [$widgets(nb_pw) panes]
2682  }
2683 
2684  # Get information
2685  get_info {} current pane tabbar tab tabindex
2686 
2687  # Get the current title
2688  set title [$tabbar tab $tabindex -text]
2689 
2690  # Remove the tab from the tabbar
2691  $tabbar delete $tabindex
2692 
2693  # Remove the tab from the current pane
2694  catch { pack forget $tab}
2695 
2696  # Display the current pane (if one exists)
2697  if {[set ctab [$tabbar select]] ne ""} {
2698  set_current_tab $tabbar $ctab
2699  set pw_current [expr $pw_current ^ 1]
2700  } else {
2701  $widgets(nb_pw) forget $pane
2702  set pw_current 0
2703  }
2704 
2705  # Get the other tabbar
2706  get_info {} current tabbar
2707 
2708  # Make sure that tabbar is visible
2709  grid $tabbar
2710 
2711  # Add the new tab to the notebook in alphabetical order (if specified)
2712  if {[preferences::get View/OpenTabsAlphabetically]} {
2713  set added 0
2714  foreach t [$tabbar tabs] {
2715  if {[string compare $title [$tabbar tab $t -text]] == -1} {
2716  $tabbar insert $t $tab -text $title -emboss 0
2717  set added 1
2718  break
2719  }
2720  }
2721  if {$added == 0} {
2722  $tabbar insert end $tab -text $title -emboss 0
2723  }
2724 
2725  # Otherwise, add the tab in the specified location
2726  } else {
2727  $tabbar insert end $tab -text $title -emboss 0
2728  }
2729 
2730  # Now move the current tab from the previous current pane to the new current pane
2731  set_current_tab $tabbar $tab
2732 
2733  # Set the tab image for the moved file

2869  proc paste_and_format {} {

2880  if {[paste]} {
2881 
2882  # Have the indent namespace format the clipboard contents
2883  indent::format_text [current_txt].t $insertpos "$insertpos+${cliplen}c"
2884 
2885  }
2886 
2887  }

2910  # file contents (if type is "all").
2911  proc format_text {} {

2914  get_info {} current txt fname lock readonly
2915 
2916  # Get the locked/readonly status
2917  set readonly [expr $lock || $readonly]
2918

2920  if {$readonly} {
2921  $txt configure -state normal
2922  }

2927  indent::format_text $txt.t $startpos $endpos
2928  }
2929 
2930  # Otherwise, select the full file
2931  } else {
2932  indent::format_text $txt.t 1.0 end
2933  }
2934

2936  # back to disabled
2937  if {$readonly} {
2938 
2939  # Clear the modified state
2940  set_current_modified 0
2941 
2942  # Reset the state
2943  $txt configure -state disabled
2944 
2945  }
2946

3203 
3204  variable widgets
3205  variable info_clear
3206 
3207  if {[info exists widgets(info_msg)]} {
3208 
3209  if {$info_clear ne ""} {
3210  after cancel $info_clear
3211  }
3212 
3213  lassign [winfo rgb . [set foreground [utils::get_default_foreground]]] fr fg fb
3214  lassign [winfo rgb . [utils::get_default_background]] br bg bb
3215  $widgets(info_msg) configure -text $msg -foreground $foreground

3219  show_status_view
3220  set hide_info 1
3221  } else {
3222  set hide_info 0
3223  }
3224 
3225  # Call ourselves
3226  set info_clear [after $clear_delay \
3227  [list gui::clear_info_message $hide_info \
3228  [expr $fr >> 8] [expr $fg >> 8] [expr $fb >> 8] \
3229  [expr $br >> 8] [expr $bg >> 8] [expr $bb >> 8]]]
3230 
3231  } else {
3232 
3233  puts $msg
3234 
3235  }
3236 
3237  }

3239  ######################################################################
3240  # Clears the info message.
3241  proc clear_info_message {hide_info fr fg fb br bg bb {fade_count 0}} {
3242 
3243  variable widgets
3244  variable info_clear
3245 
3246  if {$fade_count == 10} {
3247 
3248  # Clear the text
3249  $widgets(info_msg) configure -text ""
3250 
3251  # Clear the info_clear variable
3252  set info_clear ""
3253 
3254  # If the status bar is supposed to be hidden, hide it now
3255  if {$hide_info} {
3256  hide_status_view
3257  }
3258 
3259  } else {
3260 
3261  # Calculate the color
3262  set color [format {#%02x%02x%02x} \
3263  [expr $fr - ((($fr - $br) / 10) * $fade_count)] \
3264  [expr $fg - ((($fg - $bg) / 10) * $fade_count)] \
3265  [expr $fb - ((($fb - $bb) / 10) * $fade_count)]]
3266 
3267  # Set the foreground color to simulate the fade effect
3268  $widgets(info_msg) configure -foreground $color
3269 
3270  set info_clear [after 100 [list gui::clear_info_message $hide_info $fr $fg $fb $br $bg $bb [incr fade_count]]]
3271 
3272  }
3273 
3274  }

3285  ######################################################################
3286  # Places the panel in the window.
3287  proc panel_place {w} {
3288 
3289  variable widgets
3290 
3291  if {[winfo parent $w] eq "."} {
3292  set top [winfo height $widgets(info)]
3293  set sep .sep
3294  } else {
3295  set top 0
3296  set sep [winfo parent $w].sep
3297  }
3298 
3299  set stop [winfo reqheight $sep]
3300  set wtop [winfo reqheight $w]
3301 
3302  # Place the separator
3303  place $sep -relwidth 1.0 -rely 1.0 -y [expr 0 - ($top + $stop)]
3304  raise $sep
3305 
3306  # Place the window and make sure that the window is raised above all others
3307  place $w -relwidth 1.0 -rely 1.0 -y [expr 0 - ($top + $stop + $wtop)]
3308  raise $w
3309 
3310  }

3317  set sep .sep
3318  } else {

3322  # Remove the given panels from display
3323  place forget $w
3324  place forget $sep
3325 
3326  }

3330  proc get_user_response {msg pvar args} {

3333 
3334  array set opts {

3336  -selrange {}
3337  }

3350  $widgets(ursp_entry) selection range {*}$opts(-selrange)
3351  }

3362  }
3363

3365  focus $widgets(ursp_entry)
3366

3370 
3371  # Wait for the widget to be closed
3372  vwait gui::user_exit_status
3373 
3374  # Reset the original focus and grab
3375  catch { focus $old_focus}
3376  catch { grab release $widgets(ursp)}
3377  if {$old_grab ne ""} {
3378  if {$grab_status ne "global"} {
3379  grab $old_grab
3380  } else {
3381  grab -global $old_grab
3382  }
3383  }
3384 
3385  # Hide the user input widget
3386  panel_forget $widgets(ursp)
3387 
3388  # Get the user response value
3389  set var [$widgets(ursp_entry) get]
3390 
3391  # If variable substitutions are allowed, perform any substitutions
3392  if {$opts(-allow_vars)} {
3393  set var [utils::perform_substitutions $var]
3394  }
3395

3397 
3398  }

3695  # Returns a list of all of the text widgets in the tool.
3696  proc get_all_texts {} {

3713  # PRIVATE PROCEDURES #

3715 
3716  ######################################################################
3717  # Gets the various pieces of tos information from the given from.
3718  # The valid values for from and tos (list) is the following:
3719  #
3720  # - current (from_type only)
3721  # - pane (using in from implies the current pane)
3722  # - paneindex (using in from implies the current pane index)
3723  # - tabbar (using in from implies the current tabbar)
3724  # - tab
3725  # - tabindex (using in from implies the index of the tab in the current pane)
3726  # - fileindex
3727  # - txt
3728  # - txt2
3729  # - beye
3730  # - fname
3731  # - lang
3732  # - any key from file information (for to_types only)
3733  #
3734  # Throws an error if there were conversion issues.
3735  proc get_info {from from_type args} {
3736 
3737  variable widgets
3738  variable pw_current
3739 
3740  # Convert from to a tab
3741  switch $from_type {
3742  current {
3743  set tab [[lindex [$widgets(nb_pw) panes] $pw_current].tbf.tb select]
3744  }
3745  pane {
3746  set tab [$from.tbf.tb select]
3747  }
3748  paneindex {
3749  set tab [[lindex [$widgets(nb_pw) panes] $from].tbf.tb select]
3750  }
3751  tabbar {
3752  set tab [$from select]
3753  }
3754  tab {
3755  set tab $from
3756  }
3757  tabindex {
3758  set tab [lindex [[lindex [$widgets(nb_pw) panes] $pw_current].tbf.tb tabs] $from]
3759  }
3760  fileindex {
3761  files::get_info $from fileindex tab
3762  }
3763  txt -
3764  txt2 {
3765  set tab [winfo parent [winfo parent [winfo parent $from]]]
3766  }
3767  beye {
3768  set tab [winfo parent $from]
3769  }
3770  fname {
3771  files::get_info $from fname tab
3772  }
3773  }
3774 
3775  if {$tab eq ""} {
3776  set paneindex $pw_current
3777  } else {
3778  set panes [$widgets(nb_pw) panes]
3779  set paneindex [expr {(([llength $panes] == 1) || ([lsearch [[lindex $panes 0].tbf.tb tabs] $tab] != -1)) ? 0 : 1}]
3780  }
3781 
3782  set i 0
3783  foreach to_type $args {
3784  upvar $to_type type$i
3785  switch $to_type {
3786  pane {
3787  set type$i [lindex [$widgets(nb_pw) panes] $paneindex]
3788  }
3789  paneindex {
3790  set type$i $paneindex
3791  }
3792  tabbar {
3793  set type$i [lindex [$widgets(nb_pw) panes] $paneindex].tbf.tb
3794  }
3795  tab {
3796  if {$tab eq ""} {
3797  return -code error "Unable to get tab information"
3798  }
3799  set type$i $tab
3800  }
3801  tabindex {
3802  if {$tab eq ""} {
3803  return -code error "Unable to get tab index information"
3804  }
3805  set type$i [lsearch [[lindex [$widgets(nb_pw) panes] $paneindex].tbf.tb tabs] $tab]
3806  }
3807  txt {
3808  if {$tab eq ""} {
3809  return -code error "Unable to get txt information"
3810  }
3811  set type$i "$tab.pw.tf.txt"
3812  }
3813  txt2 {
3814  if {$tab eq ""} {
3815  return -code error "Unable to get txt2 information"
3816  }
3817  set type$i "$tab.pw.tf2.txt"
3818  }
3819  beye {
3820  if {$tab eq ""} {
3821  return -code error "Unable to get beye information"
3822  }
3823  set type$i "$tab.be"
3824  }
3825  lang {
3826  if {$tab eq ""} {
3827  return -code error "Unable to get lang information"
3828  }
3829  set type$i [syntax::get_language "$tab.pw.tf.txt"]
3830  }
3831  default {
3832  if {$tab eq ""} {
3833  return -code error "Unable to get $to_type information"
3834  }
3835  set type$i [files::get_info $tab tab $to_type]
3836  }
3837  }
3838  set retval [set type$i]
3839  incr i
3840  }
3841 
3842  return $retval
3843 
3844  }

3884  unset gui::tab_tip(%W)

3886  tooltip::hide
3887  }

3889  set gui::pw_current [lsearch [$gui::widgets(nb_pw) panes] [winfo parent [winfo parent [winfo parent %W]]]]

3892  tk_popup $gui::widgets(menu) %X %Y
3893  }
3894  }

3898

3900  theme::register_widget $nb.tbf.tb tabs
3901

3904  ######################################################################
3905  # Called when the user places the cursor over a notebook tab.
3906  proc handle_notebook_motion {W x y} {
3907 
3908  variable tab_tip
3909  variable tab_close
3910 
3911  # Adjust W
3912  set W [winfo parent $W]
3913 
3914  # If the tab is one of the left or right shift tabs, exit now
3915  if {[set tab_index [$W index @$x,$y]] == -1} {
3916  return
3917  }
3918 
3919  set tab [lindex [$W tabs] $tab_index]
3920 
3921  # Handle tooltip
3922  if {![info exists tab_tip($W)]} {
3923  set_tab_tooltip $W $tab
3924  } elseif {$tab_tip($W) ne $tab} {
3925  clear_tab_tooltip $W
3926  set_tab_tooltip $W $tab
3927  } else {
3928  clear_tab_tooltip $W
3929  }
3930 
3931  }
3932 
3933  ######################################################################
3934  # Sets a tooltip for the specified tab.
3935  proc set_tab_tooltip {W tab} {
3936 
3937  variable tab_tip
3938 
3939  # Get the full pathname to the current file
3940  get_info $tab tab fname remote
3941 
3942  # Figure out what to display
3943  if {$remote eq ""} {
3944  set tip $fname
3945  } else {
3946  set remote [join [lassign [split $remote ,] group] ,]
3947  set tip "$fname ($remote)"
3948  }
3949 
3950  # Create the tooltip
3951  set tab_tip($W) $tab
3952  tooltip::tooltip $W $tip
3953  event generate $W <Enter>
3954 
3955  }
3956 
3957  ######################################################################
3958  # Clears the tooltip for the specified tab.
3959  proc clear_tab_tooltip {W} {
3960 
3961  variable tab_tip
3962 
3963  unset -nocomplain tab_tip($W)
3964  tooltip::tooltip clear $W
3965  tooltip::hide
3966 
3967  }

3969  ######################################################################
3970  # Adjusts the given index (if necessary) such that the tab will be
3971  # inserted into the current notebook in alphabetical order.
3972  proc adjust_insert_tab_index {index title} {
3973 
3974  if {[preferences::get View/OpenTabsAlphabetically] && ($index eq "end")} {
3975 
3976  set sorted_index 0
3977 
3978  if {![catch { get_info {} current tabbar}]} {
3979  foreach tab [$tabbar tabs] {
3980  regexp {(\S+)$} [$tabbar tab $tab -text] -> curr_title
3981  if {[string compare $title $curr_title] == -1} {
3982  return $sorted_index
3983  }
3984  incr sorted_index
3985  }
3986  }
3987 
3988  }
3989 
3990  return $index
3991 
3992  }
3993 
3994  ######################################################################
3995  # Inserts a new tab into the editor tab notebook.
3996  # Options:
3997  # -diff (0 | 1) Specifies if this tab is a difference view. Default is 0.
3998  # -gutters list Specifies a list of gutters to add to the ctext gutter area
3999  # -tags list Specifies a list of text binding tags
4000  # -lang language Specifies initial language parsing of buffer. Default is to determine based on title.
4001  proc insert_tab {tb index fname args} {
4002 
4003  variable widgets
4004  variable curr_id
4005  variable language
4006  variable case_sensitive
4007  variable numberwidth
4008  variable show_match_chars
4009 
4010  array set opts {
4011  -diff 0
4012  -gutters [list]
4013  -tags [list]
4014  -lang ""
4015  }
4016  array set opts $args
4017 
4018  # Get the scrollbar coloring information
4019  array set sb_opts [set scrollbar_opts [theme::get_category_options text_scrollbar 1]]
4020 
4021  # Get the unique tab ID
4022  set id [incr curr_id]
4023 
4024  # Calculate the title name
4025  set title [file tail $fname]
4026 
4027  # Make the tabbar visible and the syntax menubutton enabled
4028  grid $tb
4029  $widgets(info_indent) configure -state normal
4030  $widgets(info_syntax) configure -state normal
4031 
4032  # Create the tab frame
4033  set tab [ttk::frame .tab$id]
4034 
4035  # Create the editor pane
4036  ttk::panedwindow $tab.pw
4037 
4038  # Create tab frame name
4039  set txt $tab.pw.tf.txt
4040 
4041  # Create the editor frame
4042  $tab.pw add [frame $tab.pw.tf -background $sb_opts(-background)]
4043  ctext $txt -wrap none -undo 1 -autoseparators 1 -insertofftime 0 \
4044  -highlightcolor orange -warnwidth [preferences::get Editor/WarningWidth] \
4045  -maxundo [preferences::get Editor/MaxUndo] \
4046  -insertwidth [preferences::get Appearance/CursorWidth] \
4047  -spacing3 [preferences::get Appearance/ExtraLineSpacing] \
4048  -diff_mode $opts(-diff) -matchchar $show_match_chars \
4049  -matchaudit [preferences::get Editor/HighlightMismatchingChar] \
4050  -linemap_mark_command [list gui::mark_command $tab] -linemap_select_bg orange \
4051  -linemap_relief flat -linemap_minwidth $numberwidth \
4052  -linemap_type [expr {[preferences::get Editor/RelativeLineNumbers] ? "relative" : "absolute"}] \
4053  -xscrollcommand [list $tab.pw.tf.hb set] -yscrollcommand [list gui::yscrollcommand $tab $txt $tab.pw.tf.vb]
4054  scroller::scroller $tab.pw.tf.hb {*}$scrollbar_opts -orient horizontal -autohide 0 -command [list $txt xview]
4055  scroller::scroller $tab.pw.tf.vb {*}$scrollbar_opts -orient vertical -autohide 1 -command [list gui::yview $tab $txt] \
4056  -markcommand1 [list markers::get_positions $tab] -markhide1 [expr [preferences::get View/ShowMarkerMap] ^ 1] \
4057  -markcommand2 [expr {$opts(-diff) ? [list diff::get_marks $txt] : ""}]
4058 
4059  # Register the widgets
4060  theme::register_widget $txt syntax
4061  theme::register_widget $tab.pw.tf.vb text_scrollbar
4062  theme::register_widget $tab.pw.tf.hb text_scrollbar
4063 
4064  # Create the editor font if it does not currently exist
4065  if {[lsearch [font names] editor_font] == -1} {
4066  font create editor_font {*}[font configure TkFixedFont] {*}[preferences::get Appearance/EditorFont]
4067  }
4068 
4069  $txt configure -font editor_font
4070 
4071  bind Ctext <<Modified>> [list gui::text_changed %W %d]
4072  bind $txt.t <FocusIn> [list +gui::handle_txt_focus %W]
4073  bind $txt.t <<CursorChanged>> [list +gui::update_position $txt]

4369  ######################################################################
4370  # Creates and displays the bird's eye viewer in the same editing buffer
4371  # as the specified text widget.
4372  proc show_birdseye {tab} {
4373 
4374  variable be_after_id
4375  variable be_ignore
4376 
4377  # Get the tab that contains the text widget
4378  get_info $tab tab txt beye
4379 
4380  if {![winfo exists $beye]} {
4381 
4382  # Calculate the background color
4383  set background [utils::auto_adjust_color [$txt cget -background] 25]
4384 
4385  # Create the bird's eye viewer
4386  $txt._t peer create $beye -width [preferences::get View/BirdsEyeViewWidth] -bd 0 \
4387  -highlightthickness 0 -font "-size [preferences::get View/BirdsEyeViewFontSize]" \
4388  -wrap none -cursor [ttk::cursor standard] \
4389  -background [$txt cget -background] -foreground [$txt cget -foreground] \
4390  -inactiveselectbackground $background -selectbackground $background
4391 
4392  # Add the bird's eye viewer to the tab's grid manager
4393  grid $beye -row 0 -column 1 -sticky ns
4394 
4395  # Setup bindings
4396  bind $beye <Enter> [list gui::handle_birdseye_enter %W $txt %m]
4397  bind $beye <Leave> [list gui::handle_birdseye_leave %W %m]
4398  bind $beye <ButtonPress-1> [list gui::handle_birdseye_left_press %W %x %y $tab $txt]
4399  bind $beye <B1-Motion> [list gui::handle_birdseye_motion %W %x %y $tab $txt]
4400  bind $beye <Control-Button-1> [list gui::handle_birdseye_control_left %W]
4401  bind $beye <Control-Button-$::right_click> [list gui::handle_birdseye_control_right %W]
4402  bind $beye <MouseWheel> [bind Text <MouseWheel>]
4403  bind $beye <Button-4> [bind Text <Button-4>]
4404  bind $beye <Button-5> [bind Text <Button-5>]
4405 
4406  set index [lsearch [bindtags $beye] "Text"]
4407  bindtags $beye [lreplace [bindtags $beye] $index $index]
4408 
4409  set be_after_id($tab) ""
4410  set be_ignore($tab) 0
4411 
4412  # Make sure that the bird's eye viewer is below any lower panel
4413  lower $beye
4414 
4415  }
4416 
4417  }

4419  ######################################################################
4420  # Highlights the currently displayed area in the text widget.
4421  proc highlight_birdseye {be txt} {
4422 
4423  # Get the start and end shown lines of the given text widget
4424  set startline [$txt index @0,0]
4425  set endline [$txt index @0,[winfo height $txt]]
4426 
4427  # Set the selection
4428  $be tag remove sel 1.0 end
4429  $be tag add sel $startline $endline
4430 
4431  }

4452 
4453  variable be_show_after_id
4454

4456

4458  after cancel $be_show_after_id
4459 
4460  # Clear the selection
4461  $be tag remove sel 1.0 end
4462

4467  ######################################################################
4468  # Handles a left button press event inside the bird's eye viewer.
4469  proc handle_birdseye_left_press {W x y tab txt} {
4470 
4471  variable be_last_y
4472  variable be_ignore
4473 
4474  set cursor [$W index @$x,$y]
4475 
4476  lassign [$W tag ranges sel] selstart selend
4477 
4478  # If we clicked on the selection, start a motion event
4479  if {[$W compare $selstart <= $cursor] && [$W compare $selend >= $cursor]} {
4480  set be_last_y $y
4481 
4482  # Otherwise, jump the view to the given location
4483  } else {
4484 
4485  set be_last_y ""
4486  set height [winfo height $txt]
4487  set be_ignore($tab) 1
4488 
4489  # TBD - We will want to make sure that the cursor line is centered vertically
4490  $txt see $cursor
4491  $txt yview scroll [expr [lindex [$txt bbox $cursor] 1] - ($height / 2)] pixels
4492 
4493  # Highlight the bird's eye viewer
4494  highlight_birdseye $W $txt
4495 
4496  }
4497 
4498  return 1
4499 
4500  }

4515 
4516  # TBD - We will want to make sure that the cursor line is centered vertically

4519

4522 
4523  }
4524

4596  ######################################################################
4597  # Handles a drag-and-drop enter/position event. Draws UI to show that
4598  # the file drop request would be excepted or rejected.
4599  proc handle_drop_enter_or_pos {txt rootx rooty actions buttons} {
4600 
4601  get_info {} current readonly lock diff
4602 
4603  # If the file is readonly, refuse the drop
4604  if {$readonly || $lock || $diff} {
4605  return "refuse_drop"
4606  }
4607 
4608  # Make sure the text widget has the focus
4609  focus -force $txt.t
4610 
4611  # Set the highlight color to green
4612  ctext::set_border_color $txt green
4613 
4614  # Move the insertion point to the location of rootx/y
4615  set x [expr $rootx - [winfo rootx $txt.t]]
4616  set y [expr $rooty - [winfo rooty $txt.t]]
4617  ::tk::TextSetCursor $txt.t @$x,$y
4618  vim::adjust_insert $txt.t
4619 
4620  return "link"
4621 
4622  }

4627 
4628  # Set the highlight color to green
4629  ctext::set_border_color $txt white
4630 
4631  }

4633  ######################################################################
4634  # Handles a drop event. Adds the given files/directories to the sidebar.
4635  proc handle_drop {txt action modifier type data} {
4636 
4637  # If the data is text or the Alt key modifier is held during the drop, insert the data at the
4638  # current insertion point
4639  if {$type || ($modifier eq "alt")} {
4640  $txt insert insert $data
4641 
4642  # Otherwise, insert the content of the file(s) after the insertion line
4643  } elseif {![::check_file_for_import $data]} {
4644  set str "\n"
4645  foreach ifile $data {
4646  if {[file isfile $ifile]} {
4647  if {![catch { open $ifile r} rc]} {
4648  append str [read $rc]
4649  close $rc
4650  }
4651  }
4652  }
4653  $txt insert "insert lineend" $str
4654  }
4655 
4656  # Indicate that the drop event has completed
4657  handle_drop_leave $txt
4658 
4659  return "link"
4660 
4661  }
