5123  ######################################################################
5124  # Finds the matching character for the one at the current insertion
5125  # marker.
5126  proc show_match_pair {} {
5127 
5128  # Get the current widget
5129  set txt [current_txt]
5130 
5131  # If we are escaped or in a comment/string, we should not match
5132  if {[ctext::isEscaped $txt insert] || [ctext::inCommentString $txt insert]} {
5133  return
5134  }
5135 
5136  # If the current character is a matchable character, change the
5137  # insertion cursor to the matching character.
5138  switch -- [$txt get insert] {
5139  "\{" { set index [ctext::get_match_bracket $txt curlyR]}
5140  "\}" { set index [ctext::get_match_bracket $txt curlyL]}
5141  "\[" { set index [ctext::get_match_bracket $txt squareR]}
5142  "\]" { set index [ctext::get_match_bracket $txt squareL]}
5143  "\(" { set index [ctext::get_match_bracket $txt parenR]}
5144  "\)" { set index [ctext::get_match_bracket $txt parenL]}
5145  "<" { set index [ctext::get_match_bracket $txt angledR]}
5146  ">" { set index [ctext::get_match_bracket $txt angledL]}
5147  "\"" { set index [find_match_char $txt "\"" [expr {([lsearch [$txt tag names insert-1c] _dString*] == -1) ? "-forwards" : "-backwards"}]]}
5148  "'" { set index [find_match_char $txt "'" [expr {([lsearch [$txt tag names insert-1c] _sString*] == -1) ? "-forwards" : "-backwards"}]]}
5149  "`" { set index [find_match_char $txt "`" [expr {([lsearch [$txt tag names insert-1c] _bString*] == -1) ? "-forwards" : "-backwards"}]]}
5150  default { set index [find_match_pair $txt {*}[lrange [syntax::get_indentation_expressions $txt] 0 1] -backwards]}
5151  }
5152 
5153  # Change the insertion cursor to the matching character
5154  if {$index != -1} {
5155  ::tk::TextSetCursor $txt.t $index
5156  }
5157 
5158  }
5159 
5160  ######################################################################
5161  # Finds the matching bracket type and returns it's index if found;
5162  # otherwise, returns -1.
5163  proc find_match_pair {txt str1 str2 dir {startpos insert}} {
5164 
5165  if {[ctext::isEscaped $txt $startpos] || [ctext::inCommentString $txt $startpos]} {
5166  return -1
5167  }
5168 
5169  set search_re "[set str1]|[set str2]"
5170  set count 1
5171  set pos [$txt index [expr {($dir eq "-forwards") ? "$startpos+1c" : $startpos}]]
5172 
5173  # Calculate the endpos
5174  if {[set incomstr [ctext::inCommentStringRange $txt $pos srange]]} {
5175  if {$dir eq "-forwards"} {
5176  set endpos [lindex $srange 1]
5177  } else {
5178  set endpos [lindex $srange 0]
5179  }
5180  } else {
5181  if {$dir eq "-forwards"} {
5182  set endpos "end"
5183  } else {
5184  set endpos "1.0"
5185  }
5186  }
5187 
5188  while {1} {
5189 
5190  if {[set found [$txt search $dir -regexp -- $search_re $pos $endpos]] eq ""} {
5191  return -1
5192  }
5193 
5194  set char [$txt get $found]
5195  if {$dir eq "-forwards"} {
5196  set pos "$found+1c"
5197  } else {
5198  set pos $found
5199  }
5200 
5201  if {[ctext::isEscaped $txt $found] || (!$incomstr && [ctext::inCommentString $txt $found])} {
5202  continue
5203  } elseif {[string equal $char [subst $str2]]} {
5204  incr count
5205  } elseif {[string equal $char [subst $str1]]} {
5206  incr count -1
5207  if {$count == 0} {
5208  return $found
5209  }
5210  }
5211 
5212  }
5213 
5214  }
5215 
5216  ######################################################################
5217  # Returns the index of the matching character; otherwise, if one
5218  # is not found, returns -1.
5219  proc find_match_char {txt char dir {startpos insert}} {
5220 
5221  set last_found ""
5222 
5223  if {[ctext::isEscaped $txt $startpos]} {
5224  return -1
5225  }
5226 
5227  if {$dir eq "-forwards"} {
5228  set startpos [$txt index "$startpos+1c"]
5229  set endpos "end"
5230  } else {
5231  set endpos "1.0"
5232  }
5233 
5234  while {1} {
5235 
5236  if {[set found [$txt search $dir $char $startpos $endpos]] eq ""} {
5237  return -1
5238  }
5239 
5240  set last_found $found
5241  set startpos [expr {($dir eq "-backwards") ? $found : [$txt index "$found+1c"]}]
5242 
5243  if {[ctext::isEscaped $txt $last_found]} {
5244  continue
5245  }
5246 
5247  return $last_found
5248 
5249  }
5250 
5251  }

5300  ######################################################################
5301  # Displays all of the unhidden tabs.
5302  proc show_tabs {tb side} {
5303 
5304  set mnu $tb.mnu
5305 
5306  # Get the shown tabs
5307  set shown [$tb xview shown]
5308  lset shown 1 [expr [lindex $shown 1] + 1]
5309 
5310  # Clear the menu
5311  $mnu delete 0 end
5312 
5313  set i 0
5314  foreach tab [$tb tabs] {
5315  if {[lindex $shown 0] == $i} {
5316  if {$i > 0} {
5317  $mnu add separator
5318  }
5319  set shown [lassign $shown tmp]
5320  }
5321  set tab_image [$tb tab $tab -image]
5322  set img [expr {($tab_image ne "") ? "menu_[string range $tab_image 4 end]" : ""}]
5323  $mnu add command -compound left -image $img -label [$tb tab $tab -text] \
5324  -command [list gui::set_current_tab $tb $tab]
5325  incr i
5326  }
5327 
5328  # Figure out where to display the menu
5329  if {$side eq "right"} {
5330  set x [expr ([winfo rootx $tb] + [winfo width $tb]) - [winfo reqwidth $mnu]]
5331  } else {
5332  set x [winfo rootx $tb]
5333  }
5334  set y [expr [winfo rooty $tb] + [winfo height $tb]]
5335 
5336  # Display the menu
5337  tk_popup $mnu $x $y
5338 
5339  }

5353  ######################################################################
5354  # Handles a text FocusIn event from the widget.
5355  proc handle_txt_focus {txtt} {
5356 
5357  variable widgets
5358  variable pw_current
5359  variable txt_current
5360 
5361  # It is possible that getting the parent of txtt could cause errors, so just
5362  # silently catch them and move on
5363  catch {
5364 
5365  # Get the text information
5366  get_info [winfo parent $txtt] txt paneindex tab txt fileindex fname buffer diff
5367  set pw_current $paneindex
5368 
5369  # Set the line and row information
5370  update_position $txt
5371 
5372  # Check to see if the file has changed
5373  catch { files::check_file $fileindex}
5374 
5375  # Save the text widget
5376  set txt_current($tab) [winfo parent $txtt]
5377 
5378  # Let the plugins know about the FocusIn event
5379  plugins::handle_on_focusin $tab
5380 
5381  }
5382 
5383  }

5416  # Scrubs the given text widget, returning the scrubbed text as a string
5417  # to be used for saving to a file.
5418  proc scrub_text {txt} {
5419 
5420  variable trailing_ws_re
5421 
5422  # Clear any snippet tabstops embedded in the text widget
5423  snippets::clear_tabstops $txt.t
5424 
5425  # Clean up the text from Vim
5426  set str [vim::get_cleaned_content $txt]
5427 
5428  if {[preferences::get Editor/RemoveTrailingWhitespace]} {
5429  regsub -all -lineanchor -- $trailing_ws_re $str {} str
5430  }
5431 
5432  return $str
5433 
5434  }

5436  ######################################################################
5437  # Jumps to the next cursor as specified by direction. Returns a boolean
5438  # value of true if a jump occurs (or can occur).
5439  proc jump_to_cursor {dir jump} {
5440 
5441  variable cursor_hist
5442 
5443  # Get the current text widget
5444  set txt [current_txt]
5445 
5446  # Get the index of the cursor in the cursor hist to use
5447  if {![info exists cursor_hist($txt,hist)]} {
5448  set cursor_hist($txt,hist) [$txt edit cursorhist]
5449  set cursor_hist($txt,index) [llength $cursor_hist($txt,hist)]
5450  }
5451 
5452  set index $cursor_hist($txt,index)
5453  set length [llength $cursor_hist($txt,hist)]
5454  set diff [preferences::get Find/JumpDistance]
5455 
5456  if {$index == $length} {
5457  set last_line [lindex [split [$txt index insert] .] 0]
5458  } else {
5459  set last_line [lindex [split [lindex $cursor_hist($txt,hist) $index] .] 0]
5460  }
5461 
5462  # Get the cursor index
5463  while {([incr index $dir] >= 0) && ($index < $length)} {
5464  set cursor [lindex $cursor_hist($txt,hist) $index]
5465  set index_line [lindex [split $cursor .] 0]
5466  if {[expr abs( $index_line - $last_line ) >= $diff]} {
5467  if {$jump} {
5468  set cursor_hist($txt,index) $index
5469  ::tk::TextSetCursor $txt.t "$cursor linestart"
5470  if {[vim::in_vim_mode $txt.t]} {
5471  vim::adjust_insert $txt.t
5472  }
5473  }
5474  return 1
5475  }
5476  }
5477 
5478  return 0
5479 
5480  }
5481 
5482  ######################################################################
5483  # Jumps to the next difference in the specified direction. Returns
5484  # a boolean value of true if a jump occurs (or can occur).
5485  proc jump_to_difference {dir jump} {
5486 
5487  # Get the current text widget
5488  set txt [current_txt]
5489 
5490  # Get the list of ranges
5491  if {[$txt cget -diff_mode] && ([llength [set ranges [$txt diff ranges both]]] > 0)} {
5492 
5493  if {$jump} {
5494 
5495  # Get the list of difference ranges
5496  if {$dir == 1} {
5497  set index [$txt index @0,[winfo height $txt]]
5498  foreach {start end} $ranges {
5499  if {[$txt compare $start > $index]} {
5500  $txt see $start
5501  return 1
5502  }
5503  }
5504  $txt see [lindex $ranges 0]
5505  } else {
5506  set index [$txt index @0,0]
5507  foreach {end start} [lreverse $ranges] {
5508  if {[$txt compare $start < $index]} {
5509  $txt see $start
5510  return 1
5511  }
5512  }
5513  $txt see [lindex $ranges end-1]
5514  }
5515 
5516  }
5517 
5518  return 1
5519 
5520  }
5521 
5522  return 0
5523 
5524  }

5527  # Finds the last version that caused the currently selected line to be
5528  # changed. Returns true if this can be accomplished; otherwise, returns
5529  # false.
5530  proc show_difference_line_change {show} {
5531

5533  get_info {} current txt fname
5534 
5535  if {[$txt cget -diff_mode] && ![catch { $txt index sel.first} rc]} {
5536  if {$show} {
5537  diff::find_current_version $txt $fname [lindex [split $rc .] 0]
5538  }
5539  return 1
5540  }
5541 
5542  return 0
5543

5546  ######################################################################
5547  # Handles a font size change event on the widget that the mouse cursor
5548  # is currently hovering over.
5549  proc handle_font_change {dir} {
5550 
5551  # Get the current cursor position
5552  lassign [winfo pointerxy .] x y
5553 
5554  # Get the window containing x and y
5555  set win [winfo containing $x $y]
5556 
5557  # Get the class of the given window
5558  switch [winfo class $win] {
5559  "Text" -
5560  "Listbox" {
5561  array set f [font actual [$win cget -font]]
5562  set f(-size) [expr ($f(-size) < 0) ? ($f(-size) - $dir) : ($f(-size) + $dir)]
5563  $win configure -font [array get f]
5564  }
5565  }
5566 
5567  }

5582  ######################################################################
5583  # Check all of the namespaces for a procedure called "handle_destroy_txt".
5584  # When a namespace is found the the procedure, call it with the given
5585  # text widget. This allows namespaces to clean up any state that is
5586  # dependent on the given text widget.
5587  proc cleanup_txt {txt} {
5588 
5589  foreach ns [namespace children ::] {
5590  if {[info procs ${ns}::handle_destroy_txt] ne ""} {
5591  eval ${ns}::handle_destroy_txt $txt
5592  }
5593  }
5594 
5595  }

5597  ######################################################################
5598  # Gets the documentation search URL and string.
5599  proc docsearch_get_input {docs prsplist args} {
5600 
5601  variable widgets
5602  variable saved
5603 
5604  upvar $prsplist rsplist
5605 
5606  array set opts {
5607  -str ""
5608  -url ""
5609  }
5610  array set opts $args
5611 
5612  # Clear the saved indicator
5613  set saved 0
5614 
5615  # Clear the entry field
5616  $widgets(doc).e delete 0 end
5617 
5618  # Initialize the text in the menubutton
5619  $widgets(doc).mb configure -text [lindex $docs 0 0]
5620 
5621  # Populate the documentation list
5622  [$widgets(doc).mb cget -menu] delete 0 end
5623  foreach item $docs {
5624  [$widgets(doc).mb cget -menu] add command -label [lindex $item 0] -command [list $widgets(doc).mb configure -text [lindex $item 0]]
5625  }
5626 
5627  # Initialize the widget
5628  if {$opts(-str) ne ""} {
5629  $widgets(doc).e insert end $opts(-str)
5630  }
5631  if {($opts(-url) ne "") && ([set name [lsearch -exact -inline -index 1 $docs $opts(-url)]] ne "")} {
5632  $widgets(doc).mb configure -text $name
5633  }
5634 
5635  # Display the user input widget
5636  panel_place $widgets(doc)
5637 
5638  # Get current focus and grab
5639  set old_focus [focus]
5640  set old_grab [grab current $widgets(doc)]
5641  if {$old_grab ne ""} {
5642  set grab_status [grab status $old_grab]
5643  }
5644 
5645  # Set focus to the ursp_entry widget
5646  focus $widgets(doc).mb
5647 
5648  # Wait for the ursp_entry widget to be visible and then grab it
5649  tkwait visibility $widgets(doc)
5650  grab $widgets(doc)
5651 
5652  # Wait for the widget to be closed
5653  vwait gui::user_exit_status
5654 
5655  # Reset the original focus and grab
5656  catch { focus $old_focus}
5657  catch { grab release $widgets(doc)}
5658  if {$old_grab ne ""} {
5659  if {$grab_status ne "global"} {
5660  grab $old_grab
5661  } else {
5662  grab -global $old_grab
5663  }
5664  }
5665 
5666  # Hide the user input widget
5667  panel_forget $widgets(doc)
5668 
5669  set name [$widgets(doc).mb cget -text]
5670  set url [lindex [lsearch -exact -index 0 -inline $docs $name] 1]
5671  set rsplist [list str [$widgets(doc).e get] name $name url $url save $saved]
5672 
5673  return [set gui::user_exit_status]
5674 
5675  }
5676 
5677 }
